page.title: 14Mr Caswell The Farmer
page.content: Mr Caswell has lived on this farm all his life, his dad also farmed. The farm is 340 acres of which most is given to arable farming, but he owns 60 Lincoln Reds, 1 bull and 25 sheep. He has a dog trained as a sheep dog. On the rich land peas, sugarbeet, grass, barley, and oil-seed rape are grown, as well as two type of wheat, Willan for bread and feed wheat for animals. He owns five tractors and a combined harvester. He works fourteen hours a day in summer and seven in winter. A typical day starts at seven-thirty he collects the sheep for dipping, spray a field,turns and bails the hay. He finishes at nine p.m. The sheep are sheered in early June. The sugar-beetis drilled in April and harvested in October.
